location=Meeting of the [[Narog]] and [[Ringwil]], west side of former

column1: '''Taur-en-Faroth''' was the range of wooded hills in [[West Beleriand]] that rose up above the western side of the River [[Narog]].<ref>{{S
column2: Index}}</ref> They were part of the Realm of [[Nargothrond]].

column1: The hills themselves were the western end of the [[Andram]]. It was among these hills that the stream of [[Ringwil]] rose and cascaded down into the main river.<ref>{{S
column2: Map}}</ref> In their steep eastern sides above the Narog, there was a network of caverns.<ref name="Return">{{S

column1: In ancient times, these Caverns of Narog known as ''[[Nulukkizdîn]]'', had been home to [[Petty-dwarves]] who dwelt there in secret<ref>{{S
column2: Doriath}}</ref> before the arrival of [[Finrod]]. What became of the Petty-Dwarves at this time is not recorded, but at least some escaped to dwell in [[Amon Rûdh]].<ref>{{CH

column1: The name is translated in full as ''Forest of the Hunters''<ref>{{HM
column2: Guide}}, entry "Taur-en-Faroth"</ref> from [[Sindarin]] ''[[taur]]'' "(great) forest", ''[[en]]'' "of" and ''[[faroth]]'', a word related to hunting.

column1: These uplands were also called ''High Faroth''<ref name="Return"/><ref>{{S
column2: 14}}</ref> or ''Hills of the Hunters'' in the [[Lay of Leithian]]<ref>{{S

column1: In the ''[[Etymologies]]'' an early [[Noldorin]] name ''Taur-na-Faras'' is given, translated as "Hill of the Hunters, Hunters' Wold".<ref>{{LR
